ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Which is bound to happen undoubtedly --
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: – and then there will be no one to deny its occurrence –
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: no soul will deny its coming.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Then none will be able to deny its occurrence.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: There is not, for its occurrence, Kadhibah.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: There is no belying its coming to pass--
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: There is no denying that it will befall -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and there can be no denying its happening,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: There is about its happening no lie.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: —there is no denying that it will befall—
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Then will no (soul) entertain falsehood concerning its coming.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And there can be no denying of its befalling.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: there is no denying its coming
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Of its occurrence, there is no denial.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: There is, at its occurrence, no denial.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [56:2] there will be no denying its coming to pass, [there is] no soul to deny [it], by repudiating it as it did in this world,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (There is no denying that it will befall) its coming cannot be repulsed, delayed or contain any ambiguity.
